column2: Got a cappuccino and bagel breakfast here. Nice ambience and medium level of business  on a Sunday morning. I really enjoyed the ambience, the kind barista, and the ability to do work in this cafe. 6 tables and lots of power outlets! However the coffee is not my favorite at all. The coffee tasted like dark roast and reminded me of Starbucks coffee. Maybe that would fit the palette of someone else, but I would come back here to do work or grab a bite, and not for the coffee.

Hi Linda- I disagree with your comparison and so would our loyal clientele, but you’re right in that maybe your palette is drawn to something different.  Thanks for the visit and the kind words about the staff.

This is a nice, unpretentious small cafe just around the corner from Alamo square. The couple who served us were super friendly and attentive. It's clean and calm inside with limited outside seating. Prices are reasonable for the neighborhood, three dollar coffee, $13.50 sandwiches. Nice place
Tks!

The Lox Bagel was super fresh, soft on the inside, lightly toasted, and warm enough to slightly melt the cream cheese, crispy cucumber, red onion, and fresh tomatoe~ Yummy! The Pumpkin Oat Milk Latte was perfect for enjoying walking through the nearby park on a fall morning.
Thanks, Mindi!  Hope to see you again real soon.

You’ll walk into this cafe from a trip to or from Alamo square (painted ladies) & think you’re in for normal sandwich/salad/coffee, how wrong you were! The man who served us was an artist of sandwiches, simplicity with effectiveness at a good price! Thank you for the meal today!
Thanks, Andrew!  Appreciate the wonderful compliments.

Unpretentious little cafe serving breakfast, bagels, sandwiches, salad and a large assortment of coffee and teas.  Around the corner from Alamo park and Painted Ladies historical houses. The neighborhood is quiet, hilly and calm - fantastic way to spend a quiet afternoon working on a laptop, free wifi. Good large coffees and polite friendly service.  Really enjoyed it this authentic no frills place.

We stopped at this local corner shop for coffee, breakfast and to keep out of the rain for a bit. I had a garden salad with eggs and ham and my husband had the egg sausage sandwich, both delicious and my salad was huge! The server was friendly and willing to I accommodate my odd egg and salad request. Definitely recommend this place for a light breakfast or lunch and you want it prepared fresh! Also, loved the 90s music they were playing!
Thanks, Christine!  Glad you enjoyed your experience with us.  We aim to please.  Come visit us again real soon.

Cute little coffee shop with delicious sandwiches for lunch.  The staff was very friendly.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that it took almost a half an hour for our party of six to get all of our food so the first person was done eating before the last person even got their food.  I would recommend the chicken pesto sandwich!
Courtney-thanks for your thoughtful review.  Your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we are certainly listening.  Hope to see you again real soon!
The sandwich I had was really great - do give this place a try. Cozy interior and friendly staff. There is some interesting art on the walls that is available for purchase via QR code.
Thanks, Will!  Appreciate the kind words.
Great breakfast and really nice stuff 💜💙
Thanks, Alex!

Absolutely poor customer service. I was made to wait for my order for 40 mins when at least 15 orders after us were already processed (racist???) Upon confronting we were rudely told that we needed to wait if we wanted the food. Poor poor customer service but expectation to be tipped is always high

Oh boy, what can I say, it was Bay to Breakers.  Obviously, you’re going for maximum pain with your (racist???) remark.  That’s a reflection on you and you should probably explore the reason(s) you would post something like this.
Great little spot! Stopped here before going to see the painted ladies, the sandwiches were delicious and the coffee was great! Will come again!
Appreciate it Danny!  Looking forward

Great sandwiches, disappointed in the BLT, very thin slice of bacon compared to the grilled chicken and black forest ham. Coffee could use more filtering, coffee grounds in the cup. Overall great spot.
Thanks, R.
Great mocha! Nice place to rest after seeing painted ladies! Clean restroom for customers.
Thanks, Elizabeth!
Vibe is great, but very disappointing coffee. I didn’t try the food but I definitely recommend getting coffee elsewhere.

well.. i just bought BLT and latte . First.  latte was pretty decent maybe because i worked at coffee industry for very long time second.  not enough bacon at least that's just me any way!  and i totally forgot to mention light on sauce! overall i like the environment; it's  small and clean place. owner was nice!. only thing is that wish they accept the EBT but it's no problem. i'll definitely go again!
Thank you…? 🥴

We stopped by on our first day in town and this little cafe was the perfect pit stop. It’s comfortable and down to earth with simple, tasty food as well. The prices are extremely reasonable and the staff was very friendly. I highly recommend Alamo square cafe if you’re in the area. We’ve already come back on our 1 week trip!
Thanks, Gracie!  Hope to see you again real soon!
Best coffee in SF. Garden bagel and breakfast sandwich excellent. Service was pleasant. We’ve been here a week and do wish we found it sooner. You must visit !!!!
Thanks, Heather!
Must visit for breakfast or lunch… great coffee and delicious sandwiches 💪🏼🤟🏼 …
Tks, Robert!

Absolutely love the cafe!  The staff is really wonderful and caring! We're regulars and love interacting with them!  If you like oatmilk drinks, I recommend their oatmilk cappuccino over the latte. Their pesto chicken sandwich is also really yum! It's also great that they have gluten-free bread, which is a bit hard to find in cafes sometimes.  Highly recommend this cute cafe with great art!
Thank you for the kind words, Aakansha!
The Cafe au lay...mind the spelling was decent.  Good place to grab ☕️ before skating..
Thanks Juan

Tried to stop by for a quick lunch. A lot of the items pictured are not on the menu, no gluten free bread, etc. probably a fine place to go if you’re a local and know what they offer, but maybe call ahead if you have dietary restrictions.

Can you be more specific about "a lot of items pictured are not on the menu"? The only thing we're out of is gluten free bread.  I don't know if you're aware, but we're in the middle of transitioning out of a 2-year pandemic that disrupted the global economy including the supply of pretty much everything and anything you can think of.   As a result, we and the rest of the service industry are dealing with challenges in sourcing some of those things we sell and use from vegetables to lids, including, gluten free bread.  As much as we would love that have that available for you, we have zero control as to when that might be the case.  I don’t know what “local guide” means exactly but I would hope that as one, I you’d be more in tune with the state of the restaurant industry at a macro level.  Hope this helps you in understanding and you reconsider your 3 star review. Also our menu is on our website: alamosquarecafe.com

Needing a boost to help us adjust timezones, we decided to stop by Alamo Square coffee for a pick-me-up before going to the Painted Ladies. The place has a great vibe that's perfect for those who want a warm & friendly neighborhood coffee shop where everyone knows your name and you're treated like a local. Our drinks were ready shorty after ordering so we set out towards Alamo Square. While walking away and sipping my latte, I noticed my order tasted different and assumed they messed it up. It still tasted great for whatever it was so I didn't care and we continued on our way. Suddenly I hear someone shouting my name from behind us and turn to see the lady from the coffee shop literally RUNNING towards us with a new drink in her hands. Even though I messed up and grabbed someone else's drink, they cared enough to run a full city block after us to correct MY mistake. We'll definitely be coming back to Alamo the next time we're the city!
Thanks Joel!  Appreciate the kind words!
Tasty coffee, plenty of seats with outlets and wifi. Ideal cafe to sit down to get some laptop work done.  In a city full of boutiquey cafes... Alamo Square Cafe is a relief.
Thanks, R!
Amazing sandwiches at this great little lunch spot. Highly recommend, especially if you are looking somewhere to eat when visiting the pink ladies.
Hi Eric!  Thanks for the compliments!  Hope you’re back soon.

Awesome service, great food/drinks (best matcha in town in my opinion), and immaculate vibes. The art is always intriguing and changes with the seasons and holidays. Wonderful spot to develop community and cozy up with their mini library! ❤️
Thanks for the kind words, Andrea!
Gorgeous sandwiches full of filling (Pesto Chicken unreal!) - really friendly service & of course great coffee !
Thanks for the wonderful review.  This is why we why we do. Visit us again real soon!
Perfect local coffee shop. Plenty of charging spots.
A small and cozy Cafe. Very nice staff!! :-) The sandwich tastes very delicious !!!
Hi 2ba- Thanks for the kind words and your splendid review!  Until next time. -ASC
Such a quaint place. Coffee and breakfast sandwiches are delicious. We grabbed our stuff and walked to the park to enjoy on the grass.
Thanks, Nelly!  Hope to see you gain real soon!

This coffee shop is a great place to sit down and study. They have wifi, they have great coffee, and they have the cafe setup such that it's easy to sit down and answer a few emails. I had a breakfast bagel and it was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. This cafe sits in a unique location, too, sitting at the opposite end of Alamo Square Park from the famous row of houses dubbed The Painted Ladies. The cafe has a small selection of very interesting books for patrons to browse.  Food: 7/10 Drinks (coffee): 9/10 Environment: 9/10 Staff: 7/10
Thanks for your review.  You should try one of our sandwiches next time and see  if we can get that food rating bumped up!

Best neighborhood coffee shop in all of Alamo Square! The wonderful owner is just a delight to see when you enter the Cafe and the coffee and food she serves is just the best! I highly recommend if you're in the area to stop by and check out the best place to support a local business for your best coffee sandwich and bagel experience! 🥰😍🥰
Thanks, Kary!  Our community rocks!

Our other local breakfast hang while we stayed in SF last month. Real nice coffee shop atmosphere and not super busy, so easy to get a table.The owner is really nice and friendly. Coffee was really good and the menu, while limited (bagels!) was certainly fit for purpose.
Hi Andrew, Thanks for your feedback.  Your opinion is very important to us, and we pride ourselves in our service, so thank you for noticing.  Hope to see you again real soon! Sincerely- ASC
Sandwich is pretty good. Also like their latte. Great place for getting brunch for a picnic by the Painted Ladies park.
Thanks, SP!

I happened to come across this cozy little coffee shop quite accidentally. To my surprise, it had everything I wanted - Good food, hot coffee and Internet connection. The variety of bagels that Alamo Square Cafe offers is fascinating. I especially liked the ones with peanut butter! Yum! They also offer a good variety of sandwiches and salads with sides. There are also a select amount of cookies and fruits available. I love the cute look the cafe has - the blackboard with the menu being written colorful chalks gives the cafe a pretty look. The place is conveniently located near the Painted ladies, one can get a coffee here and walk to the park in front of Painted Ladies and enjoy the view :-)  I am giving a 3 star rating for Alamo Square Cafe :-)

Really cute and cozy cafe for a quick afternoon lunch. We were short on time, so swung by here and gave it a shot. The staff was very quick and food was delicious! We shared the tuna fish sandwich, and had the hummus platter and a mango smoothie. the tuna fish was perfect for lunch for us. The hummus platter had hummus, pita bread, and dolmas, which were all delicious! Our mango smoothie was super refreshing too!  Seating may be tight if the cafe is filled with people working on their laptops, but definitely a nice place to grab a quick lunch, maybe even get it to go and enjoy it at Alamo Square Park! Dogs are also welcomed inside too!

If you're not a white person, don't expect any sort of customer service. The short man behind the cash register brought out food for the white couple sitting outside but left ours inside several times despite us sitting right next to them outside. Wouldn't recommend spending your hard earned at a place that's so blatantly discriminatory.

Wow!  Don’t really know how to respond to this, but as the owner of the establishment and a minority myself, I feel a little a bit offended by your comments, I’m at least 5’8!.  All I have to say is, you sir couldn’t be any more wrong.  Happy holidays to you and yours!
I recommend this coffee with all my heart. They make great avocado toast. Many varieties of tea, very rich coffee and unbeatable attention. If you want something different for breakfast, come here!
Thanks, Lucia!  We appreciate your kind words.

This is the best coffee & sandwich place you will ever visit. The sandwiches are just sooo delicious, SO good. Great atmosphere and the couple and who run the cafe are so nice, warm, friendly and generous! Pop in and try it, you'll never go anywhere again!
Thanks for sharing, Shelley!   Hope you visit us again real soon!

We loved this place! In the hustle and bustle of the crazy city we were lucky to find this little gem just around the corner from the house we rented while in town. The coffee is delicious and the pastries are even better. Friendly staff, remembered my order daily. I will miss this little place and if I am ever back we will for sure drop in.

Love this place when I'm near Alamo Square. I always stop in to grab something. Perfect spot to grab a pre park coffee. Super friendly staff who make you feel like part of the neighborhood even though you're not :).
Thanks, Jarret!  Looking forward to your next visit.

Place is cosy and quiet, so it's good for working or reading. Decoration, design are not particularly remarkable but the bagels are quit good and not expensive.  One more cafe option in SF, worth a try if you are around.

We stumbling upon this place while on our way to see the painted ladies. The food is amazing here we had bagels and coffee, why can’t we have this Quailty back home in Australia. If you are going to see painted lady’s I suggest stopping here to grab a little bit, would give this 10 stars if I could
Thanks for the wonderful review, Luke!  Maybe someday we’ll open in Australia.  But for now, you’ll have to visit us again!   Looking forward to your next visit.
Lovely quiet and historic neighborhood- awesome latte and cafe shows beautiful art of local artists- enjoy!
Thanks, Cathleen!

Very basic breakfast menu with bagels, breakfast sandwiches, muffins & assorted pastries.  Everything is made to order so it may take a few before your breakfast is in hand, but it will be done as you requested.
Thanks, Thomas!
Chai latte is good, Breakfast bagel is good, Turkey sandwich was good. Wifi was a little spotty. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Thanks, Peter!

Quick and tasty combined with the perfect service. They provide a good variety of dishes for breakfast and snack combined with a good cup of coffee or chocolate (I especially like that!!). Definitely worth a stop!

Hi Michael, Thanks for taking the time to write a review.  Your feedback is very important to us and we’re ecstatic that you appreciate our service.  We take pride in it and make it a priority. On behalf of everyone at Alamo Square Cafe, we sincerely thank you!  Come visit us again soon!

A nice little coffee shop on Fillmore and Hayes. Across the street is Walden House, a rehab. Check it out. The building was used as City Hall after the old one was destroyed in the 1906 earthquake. A nice tree with a bench under is outside and a liquor store is nearby. Stop here for a cup of coffee before you head to Alamo Square and admire the Painted Ladies and absentmindedly hum the theme song for TV show "Full House."
The best bagel i have tried & good coffee…fantastic service!!!.it s a MUST…!!!!😍 Carmen & Manuel …
Thanks for the kind words Carmen!
Amazing sandwiches and a great spot to get some work done ✅
Thanks Kritika!

A friendly & cozy place with tasty sandwiches and awesome mini cinnamon bun thingies that are only 50 cents a pop. It's a really nice break from all of the super-fancy & overpriced coffee shops around here.
My cappuccino was terrible! It tasted super burnt. I actually threw it out after two sips. The cafe itself is cute, not too crowded (possibly for a reason?) and close to the park...
Great cafe :) good food options and the owners are very friendly!
Thanks, Hugo!
My friend took me here, and i loved it. The coffee is really good, and i love the pastries they have. The atmosphere here is awesome, and really chilled.
Good food and friendly service.
Thanks, Marcia!
Perfect little dog themed coffee shop with great breakfast sandwiches and fast service.  Their condiment bar is a a huge plus
Thanks, James!  Appreciate the kind words.
Good sandwiches  made with  fresh ingredients and good coffe as well great  spot to stop by eat and relax👍 …
Thanks, Mike!
Very cute cafe, tasty food and strong coffee.
Thanks, Tiffany!   We hope to see you again real soon!
local, privately owned, and very friendly staffed. husband and wife. they also offer CBD beverages and a very high-end organic menu.
Hi K.  Thanks for the wonderful words!
Fantastic coffee, breakfast and music!
Thanks, Dragan!
Coffee is delicious. Love the atmosphere. Very good sandwiches. Chai is amazing.
Thanks, Mic!
While the barista was very nice and the cafe was cute, the iced coffee I ordered was so bitter I just dumped it out a block away. It was undrinkable.

Hi Andrew,  thanks for the visit.  I’m sorry that you didn’t find our Iced Coffee to your liking.   We take pride in our iced coffee and our customers praise us for having “real” good iced coffee.  So it surprises me to hear you say otherwise.  Sometimes if you’re used to a certain place that might have filtered iced coffee you may not always get that real coffee taste or you maybe be getting watered down coffee somewhere else.  Our iced coffee is made from the same batches our hot coffee is made from.  Anyway, again, I’m sorry you didn’t have a positive experience. If you visit us again, your next drink is on us.
Best cafe in sf, very homey and everything is made with love. 10/10 recommend
Thanks!
One of my favorite coffee shops! Excellent wifi signal too.right around the corner from the iconic "Painted Ladies"
Friendly service, great food and a nice environment. We enjoyed lunch and a local guitarist playing us music.
Very bad experience .The waitress is really really impolite. Run away

Hi Moise - Some context would help us a long way in addressing your grievance.  I should point out that your original review was reported and removed because of foul language. That makes it difficult for me to give you the benefit of the doubt and determine who was the “impolite” one here.
Great service, great coffee and affordable could use a bit more color but overall good experience service with a smile as well
Casual yet very high quality food and service. My favorite in the entire neighborhood
Thanks, Dimitry!
My wife’s soy latte was amazing. They have a good selection of bagels and sandwiches.
Hi Jiri - Thanks for you review.  So excited to hear your wife enjoyed her latte!  Come visit us again real soon!
Excellent pesto chicken and smoked salmon sandwiches.  Very reasonably priced, too.
Thanks, Thomas!
Super tasty sandwiches
Thanks, Martin!
Cute cafe with a colorful interior. The service and food are pretty standard, but the coffee could have been better.
A nice retro Cafe with an old school feel and good quality Coffee and Tea. Definitely not one of your new hipster finds.
Amazing service and evening though was closing soon helped us out with an order for 8 people
Thanks, Andrew!
One woman army was operating the cafe en seule, and so our breakfast took a moment, but my can she make a mean cappuccino!
Thanks!
Liked this place, nice, clean and quite. Sandwiches are really tasty.
Thanks for your review, Tania!   Looking forward to seeing you again.  ASC!
Great veggie bagel. Cute little spot for fast eats to go.
Thanks, Sam!  Hope to see you again soon!
Great neighborhood spot with yummy sandwiches and nice people!
Thanks, Annie!
Friendly service with local artwork to admire, walking distance to Alamo Square and tasty lattes!
Hi Evelyn- Thanks for your review.  We’re very appreciative and hope to you see you again real soon! ASC
Great food, great drinks, wonderful staff who love dogs, too!
Great place for a good sandwich.
Hi Gauthier, appreciate the compliments. Tks!
This place have wifi and stuff was nice . salmon bagel very delicious.
Charming with great coffee, and occasional artwork from local artists!
Thanks, Sohrab!
Sausage cheese and egg bagel! YOM! Best I’ve had. Impressed. 👍 …
Thanks, Nev!  We’ve got plenty more where they came from!
such a cool place and delicious food!
Thanks, Shanna!
Lovely little cafe! Good vibes and good service
Thanks, Borky!
Cozy little cafe.  Outlets and secured wifi.  Reasonably prices sandwiches.
Good coffee and great selection of bagels and fillings
The best way to go great costumer service Great food and pastries Great people work there
Ahmad, Thanks for the wonderful review and your kind words.  We aim to please! ASC
Great coffee spot...good sandwiches
Thanks, Jacore!
Relaxed atmosphere, friendly staff, generous servings.
Thanks for sharing your experience, Fran!  We hope you visit us again real soon.  Next time coffee is on us.  ASC
I am annoyed by coffee shops without a heavy cream option.
Oh Kirk ☹️.  First world problems.
Real coffee shop atmosphere with good coffee and exellent food
Great coffee and the best sandwiches in the City
The best sandwich I ever had, grilled chicken
Jan- That’s a drop the mike sort of review.  Don’t know what so say except, thanks!    Glad we were able to provide that kind of experience. ASC
The best tasting coffee with the loveliest service.
Sandwiches are pretty decent. Closes at 8 though
It’s the best coffee shop in town
Thanks, Lindsay!
The best chai! And their sandwiches are delicious!!
Loved the egg and cheese baggel!
Thanks, Celine!
Healthy food and great service!
Amazing breakfast sandwich!
Thanks, Alac!
Friendly staff. Nice coffee.
Thanks, David.  Hope to see you again on your next visit to San Francisco!
Small but kind of cool and special
Thanks for the review, Stephan!  Best one liner yet!
Super beautiful place. Safe
Thanks, Lavern!   Hope to see you again real soon!
Nice people and food!
Thanks, Goncalo!
Not great coffee! Too hot!

Hi Mike, Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We appreciate your feedback and we’re sorry your coffee was too hot.  All we can say is, we like to serve fresh coffee?  Sincerely, Alamo Square Cafe
Good breakfast 👍🏾
Thanks for the compliments!
Nice coffee 👌 …
Maria, appreciate the kuddos!
Good atmosphere & would recommend.
Thanks for the kind words, James!  We’ll see you again real soon!
Free WiFi, relaxed atmosphere
Glad you found us relaxing, Dagda!  Come and visit us anytime!
Great service, great atmosphere.
Thanks, Rich!  Hope to see you gain real soon.
Good latte and americano. Okay sandwitch.
Very, very good coffee
Hi Ben, Thanks for the review and we’re glad you loved our coffee!  We look forward to seeing you again soon!
Panini with lox is out of this world!
Great folks, personal service.
Thanks for the kind words Lisa-Anice! Hope to see you again soon!
i drink their coffee everyday... :)
Employees are wonderful!
Thanks, Ryan!
Best breakfast
Thanks, Romeo!
Tasty and nice staff!
Thanks, Marc. Hope to see you again real soon!
best mocha in town
Nice and very neighborhoodie
Good coffee
Thanks, Jason!
poor tasting espresso drinks
Dope smoothies
Great coffee
Hi Meadbh, Thanks for the review and we’re glad you loved our coffee!  We look forward to seeing you again soon!
Great breakfast spot!
Don't be fooled by the outward appearance: the staff is nice, the coffee is good and the veggie sandwich is even better. Good value for money.
Thanks, Susi!

I visited San Francisco this past October 2022, and Alamo Square Café was where I had breakfast every day. The place has a magical air and a very delicious menu: my favorite was the Bagel BLT on Sesame Bread. They definitely made my experience in SF a very special one.  MF
Thanks, Marisol!
We stopped here for a snack on our tour of the city. Super tasty, super big. Price/performance top! Highly recommended.

Delicious neighborhood cafe! The owners are very nice and helpful, there is a very good WI-FI network but, above all, the coffee and cappuccino are delicious!!! Also good selection of sandwiches and bagels!
Hi Maximilian, Thank you so much for the wonderful review. Glad to hear your experience was excellent. Hope to see you again soon! - The Alamo Square Cafe
Very rich and at a good price, I will return without a doubt!
Thanks, Valentina! See you soon!
The smile must also pay off. Very unpleasant service
Hi Charlotte, sorry you had an unpleasant visit.  Wish we knew more.

During my stay in SF it was where I went to have breakfast every day. It is the typical Cafe Bar of the American series, average prices and with vegan options. In my case I ordered: Avocado toast with gluten-free bread and coffee with soy milk. It cost me about €15 and the toasts have been the best I've eaten in my entire life. 100% recommended, hyper nice staff.
Hello Irene, thank you for your comment. Hope to see you soon!
We found our morning headquarters. Great breakfast. Great staff. great atmosphere
Glad we were able to provide comfort away from home. thank you for those kind words and hope to see you again very soon!

During the week that I stayed in San Francisco, since I was staying two blocks away, I went every day for breakfast. The site is very cosy. The food is very good and they have a wide variety both for breakfast and to eat a sandwich. My favorite is the avocado toast, I recommend it 100%. I really wanted to try the muffins, especially the chocolate one, it looked great!

Great breakfast and at an affordable price in San Francisco! And just down the street from the Painted Ladies! The BLT Bagels and Avocado Toasts are great!  Great breakfast at an affordable price in San Francisco! And just down the street from the Painted Ladies! BLT Bagels and great avocado toast!
Alberto, Thank you for the great review. Until next time!
Very typical local cafe, with few places to sit and not very popular. If you decide to arrive early at the Painted Ladies, stop by if you want to escape the Starbucks crowd.
Thanks Joao!
Nice little cafe with breakfast options.
Thank you Stefan!
Good attention and rich bagels. Perfect for a quiet breakfast in Alamo Square Park. I can't comment on the coffee, because I had it for free at the hotel.

hello echo Thank you for taking the time to write a review. Your comments are very important to us and we are delighted that you appreciate our service. We are proud of it and we make it a priority. On behalf of everyone at Alamo Square Cafe, we sincerely thank you! Come visit us again soon!
A cozy cafe near the Alamo park. The people are friendly. The sandwiches are good, but pricey. A nice place to start the day.
Calm and cozy, the staff is wonderfully nice. BLT bagel delicious. I recommend it if you are nearby.
Hi Karri,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review, your opinion is very important to us. I liked you enjoyed the Bagel BLT. I hope to see you again very soon! Best regards, Alamo Square Cafe
A little fun time with the family! For our roadtrip to SF!
Thanks Jerome! Glad you decided to bring the family to our cafe. I hope you enjoyed your road trip!
The manager is kind and the tuna sandwich is also It's so delicious and it's a local hot place^^
Very nice and welcoming. A good way to start the day with a proper breakfast.
Good coffee ☕️ very friendly!!!
Thanks Rafael!
Thanks, Trisha!
Good welcome, tasty coffee
Thank you for your review, Sergey. We hope to see you very soon!
Thanks, Rea!
Nice and warm coffee 😊
Thanks Nicholas. We appreciate your review! Until next time!
Thanks for the awesome review, Kevin!
Tks, Sandra
Thanks, Rishab!
Cozy place.
Thanks, zsh1!  That is our aim.
Thanks, Elena!  Hope to see you again real soon.
Thanks, Jonathan!
Daniel- thanks for your review!  We’re very appreciative and hope to you see you again real soon!
Thanks, Luca!   We hope to see you again real soon!

Thanks Lily !

Thanks for the five star review, Roger!   Come and visit us again real soon!
Mischief- thanks for your stellar review!  We’re very appreciative and hope to you see you again real soon!
Thanks for your review Monica!
Thanks, Paul!

Thanks, Lucas!
Hi Oriol,  Would love to know more about your visit so that we can improve upon your experience.  Please feel free to write to us at sfalamosquarecafe@gmail.com. Warm regards, ASC
Thanks for your review M NM!  Looking forward to your next visit!
Thanks, Sarah!  Appreciate ya’
Thanks, Juan!
Tks, Anthony!
Thanks, Eli!
Thanks, Maisie!
Hi Darcy,  Thanks for your review.  Your opinion is very important to us, so if there’s anything we can do to improve please send us a note at sfalamosquarecafe@gmail.com. Regards - ASC
Thanks, Nruthya!   Looking forward to your next visit.
Thanks, Ken!  Really appreciate it!
Tx for the stars, Alex!
Thanks, Gianna!
Thanks, Sandrine!   Hope to see you again real soon!
Thanks, Alex!  Hope to see you again real soon!
